intro: Galium turkestanicum, commonly known as Turkestan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky, or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Galium turkestanicum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
